intro: Batesimalva stipulata, commonly known as the stipulate mallows, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive stipules, which are leaf-like structures at the base of the petioles. The plant typically features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It is native to specific regions in southern Africa and thrives in well-drained soils. Batesimalva stipulata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ecological benefits to pollinators.
